column1: S115A.CARD.  1. CARD ONE
S115A.DECK.  115. SURVEY NUMBER
S115A.BALLOT.  X. BALLOT NUMBER GENERATED BY ROPER CENTER.

S115A.Q1. WHAT IS YOUR ARMY RANK OR GRADE?  1. PRIVATE 2. PRIVATE FIRST CLASS 3. TECHNICIAN 5TH GRADE OR CORPORAL 4. TECHNICIAN 4TH GRADE OR SERGEANT 5. TECHNICIAN 3RD GRADE OR STAFF SERGEANT 6. TECHNICAL SERGEANT 7. MASTER SERGEANT OR FIRST SERGEANT 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q2. HOW OLD WERE YOU ON YOUR LAST BIRTHDAY?  01. 18 YEARS OR LESS 02. 19 YEARS 03. 20 YEARS 04. 21 YEARS 05. 22 YEARS 06. 23 YEARS 07. 24 YEARS 08. 25 YEARS 09. 26 THRU 29 YEARS 10. 30 THRU 34 YEARS 11. 35 YEARS OR MORE 00. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q3. HOW FAR DID YOU GO IN SCHOOL?  1. LESS THAN 6TH GRADE 2. FINISHED 6TH GRADE 3. FINISHED 7TH GRADE 4. FINISHED 8TH GRADE 5. SOME HIGH SCHOOL BUT DID NOT FINISH 6. GRADUATED FROM HIGH SCHOOL 7. SOME COLLEGE BUT DID NOT FINISH 8. GRADUATED FROM COLLEGE 9. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

S115A.Q4. IN WHAT STATE OF THE UNITED STATES DID YOU SPEND MOST OF THE LAST FIVE YEARS OF YOUR CIVILIAN LIFE BEFORE YOU CAME INTO THE ARMY? E. SECTION:  01. NEW ENGLAND 02. MIDDLE ATLANTIC 03. EAST NORTH CENTRAL 04. WEST NORTH CENTRAL 05. SOUTH ATLANTIC 06. EAST SOUTH CENTRAL 07. WEST SOUTH CENTRAL 08. MOUNTAIN 09. PACIFIC 10. FOREIGN - U.S. POSSESSION 11. FOREIGN - NOT U.S. 12. U.S. - STATE NOT SPECIFIED 00. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q5. WHERE WERE YOU LIVING MOST OF THE LAST FIVE YEARS OF YOUR CIVILIAN LIFE BEFORE YOU CAME INTO THE ARMY?  1. ON A FARM OR IN THE COUNTRY 2. IN A SMALL TOWN (FEWER THAN 2,500 PEOPLE) 3. IN A TOWN (WITH BETWEEN 2,500 AND 25,000 PEOPLE) 4. IN A CITY (BETWEEN 25,000 AND 100,000 PEOPLE) 5. IN A LARGE CITY (MORE THAN 100,000 PEOPLE) 0. NO ANSWER
S115A.Q6. ARE YOU:  1. SINGLE 2. MARRIED 3. DIVORCED OR SEPARATED 4. WIDOWED 5. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

S115A.Q7. WHAT BRANCH OF THE ARMY ARE YOU IN NOW?  01. ENGINEERS 02. CHEMICAL WARFARE SERVICE 03. QUARTERMASTER CORPS 04. INFANTRY 05. MEDICAL DEPARTMENT 06. SIGNAL CORPS 07. COAST ARTILLERY AND ANTI-AIRCRAFT 08. AIR CORPS 09. ORDNANCE DEPARTMENT 10. MILITARY POLICE 11. OTHER

S115A.Q8. IF YOU HAD A CHOICE, WHICH ONE OF THESE BRANCHES OF THE ARMY WOULD YOU LIKE TO BE IN?  01. ENGINEERS 02. CHEMICAL WARFARE SERVICE 03. QUARTERMASTER CORPS 04. INFANTRY 05. MEDICAL DEPARTMENT 06. SIGNAL CORPS 07. COAST ARTILLERY AND ANTI-AIRCRAFT 08. AIR CORPS 09. ORDNANCE DEPARTMENT 10. MILITARY POLICE 11. OTHER 00. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q9. HOW DID YOU COME INTO THE ARMY?  1. I WAS DRAFTED, BEFORE PEARL HARBOR 2. I WAS DRAFTED, AFTER PEARL HARBOR 3. I VOLUNTEERED, BEFORE PEARL HARBOR 4. I VOLUNTEERED, AFTER PEARL HARBOR 5. I CAME IN THROUGH THE NATIONAL GUARD 6. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

S115A.Q10. HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN IN THE ARMY? P. IF YOU HAVE BEEN IN THE ARMY BEFORE, THEN WERE OUT FOR A WHILE, JUST CHECK THE LENGTH OF TIME SINCE YOU ENTERED THIS LAST TIME. IF YOU WERE IN THE NATIONAL GUARD, CHECK THE LENGTH OF TIME SINCE YOUR OUTFIT CAME INTO THE ARMY.  1. 9 MONTHS OR LESS 2. OVER 9 MONTHS UP TO 12 MONTHS 3. OVER 12 MONTHS UP TO 15 MONTHS 4. OVER 15 MONTHS UP TO 18 MONTHS 5. OVER 18 MONTHS UP TO 24 MONTHS 6. OVER 24 MONTHS UP TO 30 MONTHS 7. OVER 30 MONTHS UP TO 36 MONTHS 8. OVER 36 MONTHS UP TO 42 MONTHS 9. OVER 42 MONTHS UP TO 48 MONTHS 0. OVER 48 MONTHS

S115A.Q11. HOW MANY MONTHS HAVE YOU BEEN STATIONED IN THE CARIBBEAN AREA (COVERING PANAMA CANAL DEPARTMENT, AND ANTILLES DEPARTMENT - WHICH INCLUDES THE PUERTO RICAN DEPARTMENT, AND TRINIDAD SECTOR AND BASE COMMAND)*  ANP (MONTHS) 01. ONE MONTH OR LESS . . . 69. 69 MONTHS 00. NO ANSWER 99.NO CODE OR NO DATA
S115A.Q12. ARE YOU NOW STATIONED AT A POST OR OUTLYING POSITION?  1. POST 2. OUTLYING POSITION 0. NO ANSWER
S115A.V12A. EXPLANATION OF POST:  1. TRUE POST 2. IN BETWEEN POST AND OUTPOST - MORE LIKE POST 3. IN BETWEEN POST AND OUTPOST - MORE LIKE OUTPOST 4. TRUE OUTPOST 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

S115A.Q13. HOW MANY MONTHS IN ALL HAVE YOU BEEN AT YOUR PRESENT POST OR POSITION WHERE YOU ARE NOW STATIONED? (LEAVE OUT THE MONTHS YOU MAY HAVE BEEN STATIONED AWAY FROM YOUR POST OR POSITION)  ANP (MONTHS) 01. ONE MONTH OR LESS . . . 49. OVER 49 MONTHS 00. NO ANSWER 99.NO CODE OR NO DATA

S115A.Q14. IN YOUR OPINION HOW LONG CAN A MAN STAY IN THE TROPICS AND STILL DO HIS JOB WELL?  1. NO MORE THAN 6 MONTHS 2. NO MORE THAN 1 YEAR 3. NO MORE THAN 1 1/2 YEARS 4. NO MORE THAN 2 YEARS 5. NO MORE THAN 2 1/2 YEARS 6. NO MORE THAN 3 YEARS 7. NO MORE THAN 3 1/2 YEARS 8. NO MORE THAN 4 YEARS 9. MORE THAN 4 YEARS 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q15. WOULD YOU LIKE IT BETTER OR WORSE IF YOUR OUTFIT MOVED AROUND EVERY SIX MONTHS OR SO, TO SOME OTHER PLACE WITHIN THIS TROPICAL AREA?  1. I WOULD LIKE IT BETTER IF MY OUTFIT MOVED AROUND 2. I WOULD LIKE IT WORSE IF MY OUTFIT MOVED AROUND 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTIONS 16A AND 16B NOT CODED.
S115A.Q17. HOW INTERESTED ARE YOU IN YOUR ARMY JOB?  1. VERY MUCH INTERESTED 2. A LITTLE BUT NOT MUCH 3. NOT INTERESTED AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER
S115A.Q18. WOULD YOU CHANGE TO SOME OTHER ARMY JOB IF GIVEN A CHANCE?  1. YES 2. NO 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q19. CONSIDERING EVERYTHING, DO YOU THINK THE ARMY DOES ALL IT CAN TO PROVIDE INTERESTING THINGS FOR YOU TO DO IN YOUR OFF-DUTY TIME?  1. YES, IT DOES ALL IT CAN 2. DOES QUITE A BIT, BUT COULD DO MORE 3. DOESN'T DO NEARLY ENOUGH, COULD DO A LOT MORE 0. NO ANSWER
S115A.Q20. IN GENERAL, WHAT SORT OF A TIME DO YOU HAVE IN THE ARMY?  1. I HAVE A PRETTY GOOD TIME 2. IT'S ABOUT FIFTY-FIFTY 3. I HAVE A PRETTY ROTTEN TIME 4. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA
S115A.Q21. DO YOU USUALLY FEEL THAT WHAT YOU ARE DOING IN THE ARMY IS WORTHWHILE OR NOT?  1. I USUALLY FEEL IT IS NOT WORTHWHILE 2. I USUALLY FEEL IT IS WORTHWHILE 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q22. ON THE WHOLE, DO YOU THINK THE ARMY IS GIVING YOU A CHANCE TO SHOW WHAT YOU CAN DO?  1. A VERY GOOD CHANCE 2. A FAIRLY GOOD CHANCE 3. NOT MUCH OF A CHANCE 4. NO CHANCE AT ALL 5. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q23. WOULD YOU SAY THAT MOST OF THE MEN IN YOUR OUTFIT USUALLY PUT ALL THEY HAVE INTO THEIR ARMY DUTIES, OR DO THEY USUALLY WORK JUST HARD ENOUGH TO GET BY?  1. MOST OF THE MEN USUALLY PUT ALL THEY HAVE INTO IT 2. MOST OF THE MEN USUALLY WORK JUST HARD ENOUGH TO GET BY 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q24. HOW ABOUT YOU YOURSELF - WOULD YOU HONESTLY SAY THAT YOU USUALLY PUT ALL YOU HAVE INTO YOUR ARMY DUTIES, OR DO YOU USUALLY WORK JUST HARD ENOUGH TO GET BY?  1. I USUALLY PUT ALL I HAVE INTO IT 2. I USUALLY WORK JUST HARD ENOUGH TO GET BY 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q25. IN GENERAL, HOW WOULD YOU SAY YOU FEEL MOST OF THE TIME, IN GOOD SPIRITS OR IN LOW SPIRITS?  1. I AM USUALLY IN GOOD SPIRITS 2. I AM IN GOOD SPIRITS SOME OF THE TIME AND IN LOW SPIRITS SOME OF THE TIME 3. I AM USUALLY IN LOW SPIRITS
S115A.Q26. IF IT WERE UP TO YOU TO CHOOSE, DO YOU THINK YOU COULD DO MORE FOR YOUR COUNTRY AS A SOLDIER OR AS A WORKER IN A WAR JOB?  1. AS A SOLDIER 2. AS A WAR WORKER 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q27. SINCE YOU HAVE BEEN IN THIS AREA, HAVE YOU EVER HAD A FURLOUGH OF ANY KIND? (INCLUDE REGULAR, EMERGENCY, LOCAL FURLOUGHS, AND FURLOUGHS TO THE U.S.)  1. NO, I HAVE NEVER HAD A FURLOUGH OF ANY KIND FROM HERE 2. YES, I HAVE HAD A REGULAR FURLOUGH TO THE UNITED STATES 3. YES, I HAVE HAD AN EMERGENCY FURLOUGH TO THE UNITED STATES 4. YES, I HAVE HAD A LOCAL FURLOUGH 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q28. UNDER THE CIRCUMSTANCES, WHAT DO YOU THINK ABOUT THE WAY FURLOUGHS HAVE BEEN HANDLED IN THIS AREA?  1. HANDLED AS WELL AS POSSIBLE, UNDER THE CIRCUMSTANCES 2. HANDLED PRETTY WELL, UNDER THE CIRCUMSTANCES 3. HANDLED PRETTY BADLY, UNDER THE CIRCUMSTANCES 4. HANDLED VERY BADLY, UNDER THE CIRCUMSTANCES 5. DON'T KNOW 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q29. IN CASE YOU NEEDED AN EMERGENCY FURLOUGH, WHAT DO YOU THINK YOUR CHANCES WOULD BE OF GETTING ONE, IF IT HAD ALREADY BEEN LOOKED INTO AND APPROVED BY THE RED CROSS?  1. ODDS WOULD BE VERY HIGH THAT I WOULD GET ONE 2. ODDS WOULD BE FAIRLY HIGH THAT I WOULD GET ONE 3. ODDS WOULD BE FIFTY-FIFTY THAT I WOULD GET ONE 4. ODDS WOULD BE FAIRLY LOW THAT I WOULD GET ONE 5. ODDS WOULD BE VERY LOW THAT I WOULD GET ONE 6. HAVE NO IDEA WHAT MY CHANCES WOULD BE 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q30. ACCORDING TO THE PRESENT POLICY, HOW MANY MONTHS DOES A MAN HAVE TO SPEND IN THIS AREA BEFORE HE CAN BE REASSIGNED?  01. 24 MONTHS OR "24 MONTHS OR MORE" OR "OVER 24 MONTHS" 02. 18 MONTHS OR "18 MONTHS OR MORE" OR "OVER 18 MONTHS" 03. LESS THAN 6 MONTHS 04. 6 MONTHS UP TO BUT NOT INCLUDING 12 MONTHS 05. 12 MONTHS UP TO BUT NOT INCLUDING 18 MONTHS 06. OVER 18 MONTHS UP TO BUT NOT INCLUDING 24 MONTHS 07. OVER 24 MONTHS - A NUMBER OVER 24 IS STATED - E.G. 26 MONTHS 08. DEPENDS ON OUTFIT, NO LIMIT, WHEN WAR DEPARTMENT SEES FIT 09. DON'T KNOW 10. 18-24 MONTHS (THESE 2 FIGURES SPECIFICALLY NAMED) 00. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q31. IF RIGHT NOW, YOU WERE GIVEN YOUR CHOICE OF ASKING FOR REASSIGNMENT OR STAYING HERE FOR ANOTHER 6 MONTHS, WHICH WOULD YOU DO?  1. I WOULD STAY HERE FOR ANOTHER 6 MONTHS 2. I WOULD ASK FOR REASSIGNMENT 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q32. WHEN YOU HAVE PUT IN THE AMOUNT OF TIME REQUIRED BY THE ARMY FOR REASSIGNMENT, DO YOU THINK THAT THE ARMY WILL OR WILL NOT KEEP ITS PROMISE TO SEND YOU BACK TO THE UNITED STATES FOR REASSIGNMENT?  1. I AM SURE THAT WHEN MY TIME IS UP, I WILL BE SENT BACK 2. I AM FAIRLY SURE THAT WHEN MY TIME IS UP, I WILL BE SENT BACK 3. I AM NOT VERY SURE THAT WHEN MY TIME IS UP, I WILL BE SENT BACK 4. I AM NOT AT ALL SURE THAT WHEN MY TIME IS UP, I WILL BE SENT BACK 5. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

S115A.Q33. HAVE YOU HAD ANY LECTURES OR CLASSES GIVEN BY OFFICERS OR NONCOMS IN YOUR OUTFIT ON THE IMPORTANCE OF THE PANAMA CANAL?  1. NO, I HAVE NEVER HEARD ANY 2. YES, I HAVE HEARD ONE OR TWO 3. YES, I HAVE HEARD QUITE A FEW 0. NO ANSWER
S115A.Q34. HOW MANY OF YOUR OFFICERS TAKE A PERSONAL INTEREST IN THEIR MEN?  1. ALL OF THEM DO 2. MOST OF THEM DO 3. ABOUT HALF OF THEM DO 4. FEW OF THEM DO 5. NONE OF THEM DO 0. NO ANSWER
S115A.Q35. DO YOU FEEL PROUD OF YOUR COMPANY (BATTERY, SQUADRON, TROOP)*  1. YES, VERY PROUD 2. YES, FAIRLY PROUD 3. NO, NOT PROUD 4. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER
S115A.Q36. HOW MUCH OF YOUR TRAINING OR DUTY TIME IS USED IN DOING THINGS THAT DO NOT SEEM IMPORTANT TO YOU?  1. A LOT OF IT 2. SOME OF IT 3. ONLY A LITTLE OF IT 4. NONE OF IT 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q37. IF YOU WERE SENT INTO ACTUAL FIGHTING RIGHT NOW, HOW DO YOU THINK YOU WOULD DO?  1. I THINK I WOULD DO ALL RIGHT 2. I THINK I WOULD HAVE TROUBLE AT FIRST, BUT AFTER A WHILE I WOULD BE O.K. 3. I DON'T THINK I WOULD DO VERY WELL 4. I HAVEN'T ANY IDEA HOW I WOULD DO 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q38. DO YOU THINK YOU MIGHT WANT TO STAY IN THE ARMY AFTER THE WAR?  1. YES, I WOULD WANT TO VERY MUCH 2. YES, I MIGHT WANT TO, BUT I'M NOT SURE 3. NO, I DON'T THINK I WOULD WANT TO 4. NO, I WOULD NOT WANT TO AT ALL 5. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q39. HOW MUCH DOES IT BOTHER YOU WHEN YOU ARE ORDERED TO DO THINGS WHICH YOU DON'T SEE A GOOD REASON FOR DOING?  1. BOTHERS ME A GREAT DEAL 2. BOTHERS ME QUITE A BIT 3. DOESN'T BOTHER ME MUCH 4. DOESN'T BOTHER ME AT ALL
S115A.Q40. HOW MANY OF THE MEN IN YOUR COMPANY WOULD YOU SAY ARE GOOD ALL-AROUND SOLDIERS?  1. ALL ARE 2. MOST ARE 3. ABOUT HALF ARE, HALF ARE NOT 4. ONLY A FEW ARE 5. ALMOST NONE ARE 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q41. DO YOU EVER FEEL THAT YOU ARE NOT AS GOOD A SOLDIER AS MOST OF THE OTHER MEN IN YOUR OUTFIT?  1. I FEEL THAT WAY NEARLY ALL OF THE TIME 2. I FEEL THAT WAY FAIRLY OFTEN 3. I FEEL THAT WAY ONLY ONCE IN A WHILE 4. I ALMOST NEVER FEEL THAT WAY 0. NO ANSWER
S115A.Q42. HAVE YOU RECEIVED COMPANY PUNISHMENT ANY TIME IN THE PAST 6 MONTHS?  1. YES 2. NO

S115A.Q43. DO TOO MANY OF THE ARMY RULES AND REGULATIONS SEEM USELESS TO YOU?  1. NO, I NEVER THOUGHT SO 2. NO, I USED TO THINK SO, BUT DON'T NOW 3. YES, TOO MANY SEEM USELESS 4. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER
S115A.Q44A. IF YOU HAD YOUR CHOICE, WHAT KIND OF AN OUTFIT WOULD YOU RATHER BE IN?  1. IN A COMBAT OUTFIT (FIGHTING OUTFIT) 2. IN A NON-COMBAT OUTFIT 3. DOESN'T MATTER, UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q44B. WHERE WOULD YOU LIKE THIS OUTFIT YOU JUST CHOSE, TO SERVE?  1. IN THE UNITED STATES 2. OVERSEAS IN A ZONE WHERE THERE IS NO FIGHTING 3. IN A FIGHTING ZONE 4. DOESN'T MATTER, UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q45. ABOUT HOW MUCH LONGER FROM NOW DO YOU GUESS THE WAR WILL LAST WITH GERMANY?  01. 3 MONTHS OR LESS 02. OVER 3 UP TO 6 MONTHS 03. OVER 9 UP TO 15 MONTHS 04. OVER 15 UP TO 21 MONTHS 05. OVER 21 UP TO 27 MONTHS 06. OVER 27 UP TO 33 MONTHS 07. OVER 33 UP TO 39 MONTHS 08. OVER 39 MONTHS 09. INDEFINITE ANSWER INDICATING ,SHORT TIME, 10. INDEFINITE ANSWER INDICATING ,LONG TIME, 11. DON'T KNOW, UNDECIDED 00. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q46. WHICH COMES CLOSEST TO YOUR IDEA OF HOW HARD IT IS GOING TO BE TO BEAT THE GERMANS?  1. IT WILL NOT BE VERY HARD 2. IT WILL BE A TOUGH JOB, BUT OUR LOSSES WON'T BE TOO HEAVY 3. IT WILL BE A TOUGH JOB, WITH HEAVY LOSSES OF MEN AND EQUIPMENT 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q47. ABOUT HOW MUCH LONGER FROM NOW DO YOU GUESS THE WAR WILL LAST WITH JAPAN?  01. 3 MONTHS OR LESS 02. OVER 3 UP TO 6 MONTHS 03. OVER 9 UP TO 15 MONTHS 04. OVER 15 UP TO 21 MONTHS 05. OVER 21 UP TO 27 MONTHS 06. OVER 27 UP TO 33 MONTHS 07. OVER 33 UP TO 39 MONTHS 08. OVER 39 MONTHS 09. INDEFINITE ANSWER INDICATING ,SHORT TIME, 10. INDEFINITE ANSWER INDICATING ,LONG TIME, 11. DON'T KNOW, UNDECIDED 00. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q48. WHICH COMES CLOSEST TO YOUR IDEA OF HOW HARD IT IS GOING TO BE TO BEAT THE JAPANESE?  1. IT WILL NOT BE VERY HARD 2. IT WILL BE A TOUGH JOB, BUT OUR LOSSES WON'T BE TOO HEAVY 3. IT WILL BE A TOUGH JOB, WITH HEAVY LOSSES OF MEN AND EQUIPMENT 0. NO ANSWER
S115A.Q49. DO YOU THINK THERE WILL BE ANOTHER WAR IN THE NEXT 25 YEARS OR SO?  1. YES 2. NO 3. UNDECIDED 4. YES, QUALIFIED 5. NO, QUALIFIED 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q50. IF GERMANY OR JAPAN WERE TO COME OVER AND ATTACK THIS PART OF THE WORLD (CARIBBEAN DEFENSE COMMAND) WHAT DO YOU THINK WOULD BE THE MAIN THING THEY WOULD WANT TO DESTROY?  1. PANAMA CANAL 2. AIR FIELDS OR AIR BASES 3. BOMB PROOF, HQ. CO., QUARRY HEIGHTS 4. MISCELLANEOUS - INCORRECT - E.G. VIRGIN ISLANDS, N.Y. 5. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

S115A.Q51. SINCE YOU'VE BEEN IN YOUR OUTFIT, HOW DO YOU FEEL ABOUT THE NUMBER OF TALKS THAT HAVE BEEN GIVEN ON WAR NEWS OR ABOUT WHY WE ARE FIGHTING THE WAR?  1. THERE HAVE BEEN TOO MANY TALKS 2. THERE HAVE BEEN ABOUT THE RIGHT AMOUNT OF TALKS 3. THERE HAVE BEEN TOO FEW TALKS 4. THERE HAVEN'T BEEN ANY TALKS 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q52. WHAT DO YOU THINK YOUR CHANCES ARE OF BEING SENT INTO AN ACTIVE COMBAT ZONE BEFORE THE END OF THE WAR?  1. I'M ALMOST CERTAIN TO BE SENT 2. I'M FAIRLY CERTAIN TO BE SENT 3. THE CHANCES ARE ABOUT FIFTY-FIFTY I'LL BE SENT 4. I'M FAIRLY CERTAIN NOT TO BE SENT 5. I'M ALMOST CERTAIN NOT TO BE SENT 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q53. DO YOU THINK THE EQUIPMENT OF THE AMERICAN ARMY IS BETTER OR WORSE THAN THE EQUIPMENT OF THE GERMAN ARMY?  1. ALL OF OUR EQUIPMENT IS BETTER 2. MOST OF OUR EQUIPMENT IS BETTER 3. OUR EQUIPMENT IS ABOUT THE SAME AS THAT OF THE GERMAN ARMY 4. MOST OF OUR EQUIPMENT IS WORSE 5. ALL OF OUR EQUIPMENT IS WORSE 6. DON'T KNOW 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q54. DO YOU FEEL THAT MOST MEN IN YOUR OUTFIT ARE WELL ENOUGH TRAINED, OR NOT WELL ENOUGH TRAINED, TO GO INTO AN ACTIVE COMBAT ZONE IN THE NEAR FUTURE?  1. MOST MEN ARE WELL ENOUGH TRAINED 2. MOST MEN ARE NOT WELL ENOUGH TRAINED 3. HAVE NO IDEA 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q55. HOW DO YOU FEEL ABOUT THE AMOUNT OF FIRING (SHOOTING) YOUR OUTFIT DOES?  1. WE DO TOO MUCH FIRING (SHOOTING) 2. WE DON'T DO ENOUGH FIRING (SHOOTING) 3. WE FIRE (SHOOT) ABOUT THE RIGHT AMOUNT 4. DON'T FIRE AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q56. SOME OUTFITS ARE PRETTY SNAPPY AND SOME ARE NOT SO SNAPPY. NOW THINK ABOUT YOUR OWN OUTFIT ALONG THESE LINES, AND THEN CHECK THE STATEMENTS BELOW THAT COME CLOSEST TO WHAT YOU THINK ABOUT YOUR OWN OUTFIT. E. DRESS AND APPEARANCE:  1. WE SHOULD PAY MORE ATTENTION TO DRESS AND PERSONAL APPEARANCE 2. WE SHOULD PAY LESS ATTENTION TO DRESS AND PERSONAL APPEARANCE 3. WE PAY ENOUGH ATTENTION NOW TO DRESS AND PERSONAL APPEARANCE 0. NO ANSWER E. PARADES AND CEREMONIES:

S115A.Q56. SOME OUTFITS ARE PRETTY SNAPPY AND SOME ARE NOT SO SNAPPY. NOW THINK ABOUT YOUR OWN OUTFIT ALONG THESE LINES, AND THEN CHECK THE STATEMENTS BELOW THAT COME CLOSEST TO WHAT YOU THINK ABOUT YOUR OWN OUTFIT. E. DRESS AND APPEARANCE:  360 1. WE SHOULD HAVE MORE PARADES AND CEREMONIES 241 2. WE SHOULD HAVE LESS PARADES AND CEREMONIES 1056 3. WE HAVE ENOUGH PARADES AND CEREMONIES NOW 38 0. NO ANSWER E. ORDERS:

S115A.Q56. SOME OUTFITS ARE PRETTY SNAPPY AND SOME ARE NOT SO SNAPPY. NOW THINK ABOUT YOUR OWN OUTFIT ALONG THESE LINES, AND THEN CHECK THE STATEMENTS BELOW THAT COME CLOSEST TO WHAT YOU THINK ABOUT YOUR OWN OUTFIT. E. DRESS AND APPEARANCE:  674 1. ORDERS SHOULD BE GIVEN AND CARRIED OUT IN A MORE MILITARY MANNER 77 2. ORDERS SHOULD BE GIVEN AND CARRIED OUT IN A LESS MILITARY MANNER 938 3. ORDERS ARE GIVEN AND CARRIED OUT WELL ENOUGH NOW 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q57. HOW DO YOU FEEL ABOUT YOUR PRESENT WORKING HOURS? (INCLUDE REGULAR DUTY, TRAINING, AND SPECIAL DETAILS.)  1. I WORK WAY TOO MANY HOURS 2. I WORK SOME TOO MANY HOURS 3. I WORK ABOUT THE RIGHT NUMBER OF HOURS 4. I WORK TOO FEW HOURS 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q58. SINCE YOU HAVE BEEN AT YOUR PRESENT STATION, ABOUT HOW OFTEN DO YOU READ "YANK", THE ARMY WEEKLY MAGAZINE?  1. EVERY WEEK 2. ONCE OR TWICE A MONTH 3. LESS THAN ONCE A MONTH 4. I HAVEN'T READ "YANK" SINCE I HAVE BEEN AT MY PRESENT STATION 0. NO ANSWER X. COL. 80 NOT USED. CARD 2
S115A.CARD.  2. CARD TWO
S115A.DECK.  115. SURVEY NUMBER
S115A.BALLOT.  X. BALLOT NUMBER GENERATED BY ROPER CENTER.

S115A.Q59. SINCE YOU HAVE BEEN AT YOUR PRESENT STATION, WHERE DO YOU USUALLY GET A COPY OF "YANK"*  1. I SUBSCRIBE TO IT BY MAIL 2. I BUY IT AT THE P.X. 3. I READ A FRIEND'S COPY OR A COPY FOUND IN THE DAY ROOM 4. I GET IT SOME OTHER PLACE 5. I HAVEN'T READ "YANK" SINCE I HAVE BEEN AT MY PRESENT STATION 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTIONS 60, 61 AND 62 NOT CODED.
S115A.Q63. ARE YOU SATISFIED OR NOT WITH THE WAY THE G.I. LAUNDRY DOES YOUR CLOTHES?  1. I AM SATISFIED 2. I AM NOT SATISFIED 3. I DO NOT MAKE USE OF A G.I. LAUNDRY 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q64A. WOULD YOU BE WILLING TO PAY AN EXTRA DOLLAR A MONTH FOR BETTER G.I. LAUNDRY SERVICE?  1. YES, I WOULD BE WILLING TO PAY AN EXTRA DOLLAR 2. NO, I WOULD NOT BE WILLING TO PAY AN EXTRA DOLLAR 3. I DO NOT MAKE USE OF A G.I. LAUNDRY 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTION 64B NOT CODED.

S115A.Q65. THE ARMY MAKES IT POSSIBLE FOR SOLDIERS TO STUDY EDUCATIONAL SUBJECTS IN THEIR OFF-DUTY TIME. (THE UNITED STATES ARMED FORCES INSTITUTE IS IN CHARGE OF THIS PLAN). SOME SOLDIERS HAVE BEEN TOLD ABOUT THIS, OTHERS HAVE NOT. SINCE YOU HAVE BEEN IN THE ARMY, HAVE YOU BEEN TOLD ANYTHING ABOUT THESE COURSES WHICH YOU CAN TAKE IN YOUR OFF-DUTY TIME?  1. YES, I HAVE BEEN TOLD ABOUT THEM 2. NO, I NEVER HAVE BEEN TOLD ABOUT THEM 3. I'M NOT SURE IF I'VE BEEN TOLD OR NOT 0. NO ANSWER P. BELOW IS A MAP OF THE PART OF THE WORLD YOU ARE NOW IN. LOOK AT IT CAREFULLY AND THEN ANSWER THE QUESTIONS THAT ARE ON THIS PAGE.

S115A.Q66. DRAW A LINE ON THE MAP AS CLOSE AS YOU CAN, TO SHOW WHERE THE PANAMA CANAL IS LOCATED.  1. VERY CLOSE TO CORRECT 2. FAIRLY CLOSE TO CORRECT 3. SOME IDEA BUT NOT CLOSE 4. NO IDEA AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q67. NOW PUT A VERY SMALL X TO SHOW AS CLOSE AS YOU CAN WHERE YOU ARE NOW STATIONED.  1. VERY CLOSE TO CORRECT 2. FAIRLY CLOSE TO CORRECT 3. SOME IDEA BUT NOT CLOSE 4. NO IDEA AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER
S115A.Q68. WHAT IS THE NAME OF THE COUNTRY (SHADED IN BLACK), THAT THE SMALL ARROW POINTS TO?  1. PUERTO RICO 2. ECUADOR 3. COLOMBIA 4. GUATEMALA 5. VENEZUELA 0. NO ANSWER
S115A.Q69. WHAT IS THE NAME OF THE ISLAND THAT THE LONG ARROW POINTS TO?  1. TRINIDAD 2. PUERTO RICO 3. WEST INDIES 4. TABOGA 5. GALAPAGOS 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q70. WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING COUNTRIES HAS NOT BROKEN OFF RELATIONS WITH GERMANY AND JAPAN?  1. INDICATES THAT ALL HAVE BROKEN RELATIONS OR THAT ARGENTINA HAS NOW BROKEN RELATIONS (ARGENTINA BROKE RELATIONS IN MIDDLE OF SURVEY) 2. NOT CHOSEN
S115A.Q70. WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING COUNTRIES HAS NOT BROKEN OFF RELATIONS WITH GERMANY AND JAPAN?  80 1. PERU 1615 2. NOT CHOSEN
S115A.Q70. WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING COUNTRIES HAS NOT BROKEN OFF RELATIONS WITH GERMANY AND JAPAN?  104 1. BRAZIL 1591 2. NOT CHOSEN
S115A.Q70. WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING COUNTRIES HAS NOT BROKEN OFF RELATIONS WITH GERMANY AND JAPAN?  1107 1. ARGENTINA 588 2. NOT CHOSEN
S115A.Q70. WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING COUNTRIES HAS NOT BROKEN OFF RELATIONS WITH GERMANY AND JAPAN?  24 1. MEXICO 1671 2. NOT CHOSEN
S115A.Q70. WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING COUNTRIES HAS NOT BROKEN OFF RELATIONS WITH GERMANY AND JAPAN?  42 1. COLOMBIA 1653 2. NOT CHOSEN
S115A.Q70. WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING COUNTRIES HAS NOT BROKEN OFF RELATIONS WITH GERMANY AND JAPAN?  115 1. NO ANSWER 1580 2. NOT CHOSEN

S115A.Q71. UP TO NOW, HAS THE WAR MADE THINGS BETTER OR WORSE FOR YOUR FAMILY AND FRIENDS BACK HOME (SUCH THINGS AS JOBS, PAY, AND LIVING CONDITIONS)*  1. THINGS ARE A LOT BETTER 2. S115A.Q73. AFTER THE WAR, DO YOU THINK THE UNITED STATES SHOULD DRAFT ALL YOUNG MEN FOR A CERTAIN AMOUNT OF ARMY TRAINING, OR SHOULD WE GO BACK TO THE REGULAR ARMY SYSTEM OF TAKING VOLUNTEERS ONLY?  1. DRAFT ALL YOUNG MEN FOR A CERTAIN AMOUNT OF ARMY TRAINING 2. GO BACK TO TAKING VOLUNTEERS ONLY 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q74. AFTER THE WAR, IF ALL YOUNG MEN IN THE UNITED STATES WERE TO BE GIVEN MILITARY TRAINING, FOR ABOUT HOW LONG A TIME DO YOU THINK EACH MAN SHOULD GET TRAINING?  1. ABOUT 6 MONTHS 2. ABOUT 1 YEAR 3. ABOUT 1 1/2 YEARS 4. ABOUT 2 YEARS 5. MORE THAN 2 YEARS 0. NO ANSWER

S115A.Q75. AFTER THE WAR, IF THE GOVERNMENT WAS TO DECIDE TO GIVE ALL YOUNG MEN ONE YEAR OF MILITARY TRAINING, WHICH ONE OF THESE PLANS WOULD COME CLOSEST TO YOUR OWN OPINION OF WHAT SHOULD BE DONE?  1. THE YEAR SHOULD BE PICKED BY THE MAN HIMSELF AT ANY TIME BETWEEN 17 AND 24 YEARS OLD 2. THE YEAR SHOULD BE SERVED AFTER HIGH SCHOOL, OR IF THE MAN DOES NOT GO TO OR FINISH HIGH SCHOOL, TO BE SERVED WHEN HE IS 18 YEARS OLD 3. THE YEAR SHOULD BE SERVED WHEN THE MAN IS 21 YEARS OLD, OR AFTER FINISHING COLLEGE 4. OTHER 5. NO TRAINING SHOULD BE GIVEN 6. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA
